thread.title: Blue Jays outlast Royals 11-8 in Game 3 of ALCS
thread.title_full: Blue Jays outlast Royals 11-8 in Game 3 of ALCS

author: Howie Rumberg
title: Blue Jays outlast Royals 11-8 in Game 3 of ALCS
text:
TEAM PAGE: Toronto Blue Jays 
Troy Tulowitzki and Josh Donaldson each homered in a six-run third inning, and Toronto's bats broke out at home for an 11-8 victory over the Kansas City Royals on Monday night that trimmed the Blue Jays' deficit to 2-1 in the American League Championship Series. 
Ryan Goins also connected and had a two-run single, one game after his misplayed pop fly set off Kansas City's winning rally Sunday. 
Veteran knuckleballer R.A. Dickey will try to get the Blue Jays even in the best-of-seven series on Tuesday (4:07 p.m. ET). He faces Kansas City's six-foot-10 right-hander Chris Young in Game 4. 
After the resilient Royals rallied for four runs in the ninth, Roberto Osuna closed it out. 
In the first ALCS game in Toronto since 1993, Tulowitzki connected for a three-run shot off Johnny Cueto, and Donaldson hit a two-run drive off Kris Medlen as the Blue Jays hit their first home runs of the series. 
Cueto failed to retire a batter in the third inning, allowing eight runs and six hits in the worst post-season start of his career.
